intro: Matelea acutissima, commonly known as the acuteleaf matelea, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tubular, pink to reddish flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
